meanings.definition: A person or thing that seals.
meanings.sent1: The sealers made sure the envelopes were closed tightly.
meanings.sent2: I bought some sealers to help keep my food fresh.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sealers decided to seal the door shut as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a sealer, closing off any doubts or worries.
meanings.sent5: The sealer at the aquarium effortlessly closed the tank to keep the fish safe.

meanings.definition: A substance used to seal something.
meanings.sent1: The sealer was sticky and helped keep the paper together.
meanings.sent2: I applied the sealer to the cracks in the window to prevent drafts.
meanings.sent3: The sealer spilled all over the table, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: His promise was like a sealer, ensuring their friendship would last.
meanings.sent5: The sealer on the envelope kept the letter secure during its journey.

meanings.definition: A device used to seal containers.
meanings.sent1: The sealer was used to close the bags of chips at the store.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a sealer from my neighbor to seal the jars of jam.
meanings.sent3: The automatic sealer malfunctioned and sealed the box shut too early.
meanings.sent4: The sealer worked like magic, preserving the freshness of the food.
meanings.sent5: The sealer hummed softly as it sealed the plastic containers.
